Raising/Lowering¶

The raising_lowering module just has one script, shift_j.py, which applies the raising and lowering operators to a wavefunction file generated by NCSD.

Note that if you have zipped .egv files, you don’t have to unzip them, the code will do that automatically if needed.

  1. Make sure you’re on cedar, in an interactive session.

    To enter an interactive session, do something like this:

    salloc --account=rrg-navratil --time=0-08:00 --ntasks=1 --mem-per-cpu=4G

  2. Open raising_lowering/shift_j.py. You’ll see some parameters to adjust:

    eig_path = "/scratch/callum/Li8Li9/ncsd/output/mfdp.egv"
exe_path = "eigv_Jplus.exe"
N = 6
Z = 3
max_2J = 5

    Edit them as needed.

    In this case, the initial values of 2J and 2T will be 1 and 3.

    So if we want to have eigenvector files with 2J from -3 to 3, say, we could change the last line there, to this:

    max_2J = 3

    Or if we wanted -7 to 7:

    max_2J = 7

  3. Run the file:

    python shift_j.py

    This will create new, J-shifted .egv files, in the same location as the original files. Just wait for this to finish and you’re done!
